transcript:
after the death of Count Bezukhov, he would call Pierre, or go to him himself, and tell him what ought to be done in a tone of weariness and assurance, as if he were adding every time: "You know I am overwhelmed with business and it is purely out of charity that I trouble myself about you, and you also know quite well that what I pro- pose is the only thing possible." 
"Well, my dear fellow, tomorrow we are off at last," said Prince Vasfli one day, closing his eyes and fingering Pierre's elbow,
